benchmark_details.name: Hanfu-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Hanfu-Bench is a manually curated multimodal dataset composed of traditional Chinese Hanfu designs spanning various dynasties, designed to evaluate cultural visual understanding and cultural image transcreation capabilities of Vision-Language Models (VLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate models' ability to understand and apply temporal-cultural features related to traditional Chinese Hanfu through visual question answering and image transcreation tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Current models struggle to accurately capture and adapt traditional cultural elements into modern designs.

data.source: Curated images collected from online retailers and television series related to historical Chinese attire.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on human evaluations and comparisons of generated images against input images.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate strong performance in retaining cultural elements and adapting them for modern contexts.
methodology.baseline_results: Current VLMs show limited success with the best-performing model achieving only 42% in cultural image transcreation tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through multiple rounds of expert and non-expert assessments.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset uses publicly available images without commercial intent.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license, restricting to academic and non-commercial use.
